Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2011 11:49AM klucyg wrote: I just ran across this thread.  I had my first chemo treatment on June 14, and my second one on July 5.  I've been pretty lucky as far as side effects.  I do have a lot of stomach burning - no nausea.  The medicine really helps with that though.  My hair starting falling on day 12 and by June 28 it was so bad that I had my son-in-law buzz my head.  I haven't had any issues with my head hurting though.  I have a great wig and wear it to work.  At home I go topless.  :)  But, I'm single and live alone so no one has to put up with my bald head except me.  Although it's always a shock when I look in the mirror.  Leg and pit hair is no longer growing, but still have bangs down below. :)  I've had some sinus issues too - but not as bad after this treatment as the first.  Thanks for letting me ramble and the best to all of you!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2011 04:36AM klucyg wrote: I just finished this week partial breast radiation with the SAVI catheter.  Although the catheter was inconvenient and uncomfortable, I am glad I chose it.  If you would like more info, please feel free to contact me.
Posts.Title: SAVI breast brachytherapy - 5 day ktab96 DebConway

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2011 08:19PM klucyg wrote: Thanks for bumping this.  I had my first chemo treatment today.  Needless to say, I was very nervous. However, the "chemo team" helped me to feel at ease and my oncologist is great.  I've started my "survival kit" and bought a couple good hats to shield me from the sun.  Thanks again for the great info.
